name: Mah-Haw (Thai Seasoned Pork on Pineapple)
author: Toi
summary: Pineapple and pork just love one another! This savory-sweet-tart appetizer is so delicious that I have been known to clear half a plate and call it dinner...
ingredients: 2 tablespoons peeled and chopped cilantro root
2 tablespoons garlic, peeled and coarsely chopped
2  Thai red chile peppers (prik chee fah), cut into tiny slivers
directions: Place peppercorns in a mortar and pound with a pestle until finely ground
Add cilantro root and garlic; pound until everything is mashed together well
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook garlic paste until fragrant, about 2 minutes
Add pork and cook, stirring often, until pork is cooked through and mixed well with garlic paste, about 5 minutes
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar and stir until well combined
Taste pork; it should taste savory with a hint of sweetness
Peel, core, and slice pineapple into 1-inch slices
Cut slices into bite-sized pieces and lay onto a serving dish
Top pineapple pieces with pork mixture
Garnish each pineapple piece with a cilantro leaf and a sliver of red chile pepper
